p: Plastics contain nearly 3 times more hydrogen than the pulverized coal and use of plastics increases the H 2 content within and in the off gas exiting the blast furnace. The increased bosh gas H 2 reduces the pressure drop to allow a greater gas flow for the same pressure by decreasing the bosh gas density. Injecting waste plastics lowers CO 2 emissions by about 30% in comparison to coke and coal [ 59].
